messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: unschooling/video games
messages.msgSnippet: ... From: Betsy  **I had a reassuring ... I was gone for a couple of days this weekend,  my son was home with my dh. Just this
messages.messageBody:
----- Original Message -----
From: "Betsy" <ecsamhill@...>

**I had a reassuring
> discussion with my dh who agreed with me that our son seems to learn
> best from videos, games and taking walks.**


I was gone for a couple of days this weekend, my son was home with my dh.

Just this morning my dh says "I am totally behind you on it being OK for
Alec to be on the PS2 as much as he wants." Cool! Tim, dh, has always
been pretty supportive of my unschooling choices, but he must have still
been questioning the time that Alec spends on games.

They bought a Final Fantasy X game at a pawn shop this weekend and Alec
spent most of Saturday researching information on the computer. The reason
it was so cheap at the pawn shop was because it came without an instruction
book. Well, with the internet and all, no problem!

Kelli~
